summary: Email chain between a DOJ Attaché at the U.S. Embassy in Paris and an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York, discussing coordination with the Paris prosecutor's office regarding the French investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The emails focus on establishing secure communication channels and the confidentiality of sharing witness information and investigative details between the U.S. and French authorities.

persons.name: Aude Groualle
persons.context: Named as a contact at the minors section of the Paris prosecutor's office with whom the DOJ Attaché had a phone call on September 4, 2019, regarding the French Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the French criminal inquiry for rape and sexual assault against minors, and the U.S. investigation into him and his co-conspirators.

connections.person2: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Coordinating communication and information sharing between the U.S. Department of Justice and the Paris prosecutor's office regarding the Epstein investigations.
Had a phone call on September 4, 2019, and is a direct contact at the Paris prosecutor's office for discussing the French Epstein investigation.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Part of the SDNY team handling the U.S. investigation into Epstein and his co-conspirators.

events.title: French criminal inquiry entrusted
events.description: The Paris prosecutor's office entrusted a criminal inquiry to the Central Group of Minor Victims of the Central Office for the Repression of Violence Against Persons regarding acts of rape and sexual assault against minors, related to Epstein.

events.title: Phone call with Paris prosecutor's office
events.description: DOJ Attaché had a call with Aude Groualle from the Paris prosecutor's office to discuss the confidentiality of information sharing regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned search of Epstein's French residence
events.description: The Paris prosecutor's office was preparing to execute search warrants, possibly as early as the week of September 9, 2019, at Epstein's residence in France.

keyFacts: The Paris prosecutor's office opened a criminal inquiry on August 23, 2019, into rape and sexual assault against minors related to Jeffrey Epstein.
French authorities were preparing to execute search warrants at Epstein's French residence as early as September 2019.
U.S. and French prosecutors were coordinating to share information while navigating strict French confidentiality rules under Article 11 of the French code of criminal procedure.
The French investigation was being handled by the Central Group of Minor Victims of the Central Office for the Repression of Violence Against Persons.
The email chain reveals high-level coordination between the SDNY and the Paris prosecutor's office, indicating international investigative cooperation.
